meanings.sent1: She relaid the puzzle pieces to start over.
meanings.sent2: He relaid the bricks to fix the crooked path.
meanings.sent3: The cat relaid on the freshly made bed, messing up the sheets.
meanings.sent4: The teacher relaid the foundation of knowledge in the student's mind.
meanings.sent5: The gardener relaid the flowerbed with colorful blooms.

meanings.definition: To lay out again or afresh.
meanings.sent1: After the wind blew them away, she relaid the picnic blanket.
meanings.sent2: The architect relaid the blueprint to include the new changes.
meanings.sent3: The chef relaid the ingredients on the counter for the third time.
meanings.sent4: The artist relaid the colors on the canvas to create a new masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The planner relaid the event schedule for better organization.

meanings.definition: To lay down again or anew.
meanings.sent1: The homeowner relaid the carpet to cover the stains.
meanings.sent2: The farmer relaid the seeds in the freshly tilled soil.
meanings.sent3: The child relaid the toys in a different pattern on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The writer relaid the plot of the story to enhance the suspense.
meanings.sent5: The worker relaid the cables to improve the network connection.
